Reviews/Synopsis
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Please go to the following website for detailed information:
 <a href="
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Miracle_Fighters" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Miracle_Fighters</a>

Miracle Fighters is not known for a stellar plot or gripping intrigue, and instead entertains in nearly other way imaginable. The film possesses an odd sense of humor but also boundless imagination, and features hilarious action sequences that must be seen to be believed.
 Yuen Woo Ping and his brothers give the action a supernatural theme, but also a comedic one, with numerous surprising, action-packed, and comic set pieces that haven't lost their ability to entertain even decades later. 
Collectively known as the Yuen Clan, Yuen and his brothers were responsible for many of Hong Kong Cinema's most entertaining and inventive action films, including Buddhist Fist, Dreadnaught, and Legend of a Fighter. 
 Perhaps most famously, Yuen Woo Ping directed his own father, Simon Yuen Siu Tien in the 1978 Jackie Chan classic Drunken Master.
